creator: wikaho@wi.uni-muenster.de
text:
The placement of the clickable hot spot area of a fo:basic-link differs from the 
placement of the fo:basic-link's text, if display-align="center" or 
display-align="after" is used. In both cases (only) the hot spot is placed as if 
display-align="before" would have been used. 




For example this does not work:




<fo:table table-layout="fixed">


    <fo:table-column column-width="20cm"/>




    <fo:table-body>


        <fo:table-row display-align="center" height="10cm">


            <fo:table-cell text-align="center" border-style="solid" 
border-color="red" padding="5mm">


                <fo:block>


                    <fo:basic-link internal-destination="dest">Dies ist ein 
Link.</fo:basic-link>


                </fo:block>


            </fo:table-cell>


        </fo:table-row>


    </fo:table-body>


</fo:table>
